      • createNewGame

        int createNewGame(java.lang.String name,
                  int currentPlayer)
        Creates a new game in the DB.
        Parameters:
        name - The game's name.
        currentPlayer - The ID of the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        The game_id of the newly created game.

        Returns:
        The number of hotels left in the bank.

      • getSavedGames

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSavedGames()
        Fetches the game names of all saved games.
        Returns:
        All the game names contained in an ArrayList.

      • getPlayersFromGame

        java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayersFromGame(int id)
        Fetches all players from the DB with game_id = id using the DB View "fullplayer". Creates the players, and sets all their saved attributes.
        Parameters:
        id - The game_id to fetch players from
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing all the players.

      • getFieldsFromGame

        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getFieldsFromGame(int gameID)
        Fetches saved fields from the DB on a given game. Example to get num_hotels from the 2 row: num_hotels = ret.get(1).get(3);
        Parameters:
        id - The game_id in the DB to fetch saved fields from
        Returns:
        A 2 dim integer List where each field is represented as the first row, and the retrieved data in the second list, in the following order: field_id, player_id, num_houses, num_hotels.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        int getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns:
        The playerID of the current player in the current game.
